gw.api.bean.compare

Class InitializableMatcherBase<T extends KeyableBean>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.bean.compare.MatcherBase<T>

    EntityMatcher<T>, InitializableMatcher

    public abstract class InitializableMatcherBase<T extends KeyableBean>
extends MatcherBase<T>
implements InitializableMatcher
    Base implementation for EntityMatcher matchers} that need to logically match on other related entity types.
    Author:
    bspies

      • doRelatedEntitiesMatch

        protected <E extends KeyableBean> boolean doRelatedEntitiesMatch(E o1,
                                                                 E o2)
        Finds the matcher for the given entities from the MatcherContext, and returns whether or not the two entities match. Since this method is normally called from one matcher implementation and invokes another matcher, it produces a dependency between the matchers. It's possible for these dependencies to create a cycle. For example, if AMatcher.doEntitiesMatch calls this method with a1.B and a2.B, which invokes BMatcher, but then BMatcher.doEntitiesMatch calls this method with b1.A and b2.A, it could recurse indefinitely. To break that cycle, this method returns true if it determines that it is in a recursive call for a given pair of beans, and assumes that the matchers will fall back on other conditions.
        Parameters:
        o1 - The first value to compare
        o2 - The second value to compare
        Returns:
        true if the two entities are logically equivalent or if it is a recursive call to the method for a given pair of beans
        See Also:
        EntityMatcher.doEntitiesMatch(entity.KeyableBean, entity.KeyableBean)

      • getSpecificMatcher

        protected <E extends KeyableBean> EntityMatcher<E> getSpecificMatcher(E bean)
        Gets the specific for the type of the given bean, i.e., does not traverse supertypes to find a matcher.
        Parameters:
        bean - The bean to get the matcher for
        Returns:
        The matcher or null if none is defined
